org.flexiblepower.observation

Class ObservationTranslationHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.flexiblepower.observation.ObservationTranslationHelper

  • public final class ObservationTranslationHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    This utility class has a 2 methods that are used by the Observation.getValueMap() and Observation.getValue(String) methods. It finds the all the getX() methods of a class using the getGetterMethods(Class) function and it can test if it is a valid java bean (see isJavaBean(Class).

      static java.lang.Object getMember(java.lang.Object object, java.lang.String name)

    • Method Detail

      • getGetterMethods

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.reflect.Method> getGetterMethods(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class from which it will detect all the getter methods.
        Returns:
        A map with the names of the members as key and the Method as value.

      • isJavaBean

        public static boolean isJavaBean(java.lang.Class<?> type)
        Parameters:
        type - The class that will be checked if it is a java bean
        Returns:
        true when the given type is a java bean that contains at least 1 getter method and that is not a primitive (see isPrimite(Class).

      • getMember

        public static java.lang.Object getMember(java.lang.Object object,
                         java.lang.String name)
        Gets the member of the given object. This supports deep references by using the '.' in between the names (e.g. looking for the member "location.geo.latitude" will effectively call object.getLocation().getGeo().getLatitude()).
        Parameters:
        object - The object on which to call the getter methods.
        name - The name of the member that is needed. For deep referencing use the dot as a seperator.
        Returns:
        The member or null if it did not exist.

      • executeMethod

        public static java.lang.Object executeMethod(java.lang.Object object,
                             java.lang.reflect.Method method)
        Executes the method on the object. This call the AccessibleObject.setAccessible(boolean) first to make sure it can be called. Then it calls the Method.invoke(Object, Object...) to really execute the method. This will also handle any Exception thrown by the invocation by wrapping it in a RuntimeException.
        Parameters:
        object - The object on which to call the method.
        method - The Method that should be used.
        Returns:
        The result of the invocation.
